newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Oracle makes Singapore Asia Pacific hub.
newsitem.headline: Oracle makes Singapore Asia Pacific hub.

text.p: Oracle Asia Pacific (Oracle), a unit of U.S. computer company Oracle Corp, said it had made Singapore its Asia Pacific network hub with the opening of a new data centre on the island republic.
Oracle said in a statement the US$1 million centre would provide all business systems support for the company's network of 60 offices throughout the Asia Pacific region.
It quoted Martin Buchholz, Oracle Corp director of Information Technology, as saying the focus of the data centre was to implement and maintain financial systems.
The data centre is located within Telepark, a Singapore $150 million facility for computer data and telecommunications operations launched by Singapore Telecommunications Ltd in November.

Buchholz said Oracle had made Singapore its regional hub because of its multi-cultural society and its strategic location. "The multinational environment makes doing business in the region advantageous as many of our customers come from multi-ethnic backgrounds," he said.
"Where business is concerned, this is the region of growth, especially China, India and Korea and these places are easily accessible from here," Buchholz added.
